description: Updates Audit Manager settings for the current account.

parameters.name: defaultAssessmentReportsDestination
parameters.description: The default S3 destination bucket for storing assessment reports. destinationType (string) --- The destination type, such as Amazon S3. destination (string) --- The destination bucket where Audit Manager stores assessment reports.

nested_params.name: destinationType
nested_params.description: The destination type, such as Amazon S3.

nested_params.name: destination
nested_params.description: The destination bucket where Audit Manager stores assessment reports.

parameters.name: defaultProcessOwners
parameters.description: A list of the default audit owners. (dict) --- The wrapper that contains the Audit Manager role information of the current user. This includes the role type and IAM Amazon Resource Name (ARN). The type of customer persona. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.

nested_params.name: roleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.

parameters.name: evidenceFinderEnabled
parameters.description: Specifies whether the evidence finder feature is enabled. Change this attribute to enable or disable evidence finder.

parameters.name: deregistrationPolicy
parameters.description: The deregistration policy for your Audit Manager data. You can use this attribute to determine how your data is handled when you deregister Audit Manager. deleteResources (string) --- Specifies which Audit Manager data will be deleted when you deregister Audit Manager. If you set the value to ALL, all of your data is deleted within seven days of deregistration. If you set the value to DEFAULT, none of your data is deleted at the time of deregistration. However, keep in mind that the Audit Manager data retention policy still applies. As a result, any evidence data will be deleted two years after its creation date. Your other Audit Manager resources will continue to exist indefinitely.

nested_params.name: deleteResources
nested_params.description: Specifies which Audit Manager data will be deleted when you deregister Audit Manager.

parameters.name: defaultExportDestination
parameters.description: The default S3 destination bucket for storing evidence finder exports. destinationType (string) --- The destination type, such as Amazon S3. destination (string) --- The destination bucket where Audit Manager stores exported files.

nested_params.name: destinationType
nested_params.description: The destination type, such as Amazon S3.

nested_params.name: destination
nested_params.description: The destination bucket where Audit Manager stores exported files.

nested_items.name: isAwsOrgEnabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether Organizations is enabled.

nested_items.name: snsTopic
nested_items.description: The designated Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic.

nested_items.name: defaultAssessmentReportsDestination
nested_items.description: The default S3 destination bucket for storing assessment reports.

nested_items.name: destinationType
nested_items.description: The destination type, such as Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: destination
nested_items.description: The destination bucket where Audit Manager stores assessment reports.

nested_items.name: defaultProcessOwners
nested_items.description: The designated default audit owners.

nested_items.name: roleType
nested_items.description: The type of customer persona.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.

nested_items.name: kmsKey
nested_items.description: The KMS key details.

nested_items.name: evidenceFinderEnablement
nested_items.description: The current evidence finder status and event data store details.

nested_items.name: eventDataStoreArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudTrail Lake event data store that's used by evidence finder. The event data store is the lake of evidence data that evidence finder runs queries against.

nested_items.name: enablementStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the evidence finder feature and the related event data store.
ENABLE_IN_PROGRESS means that you requested to enable evidence finder. An event data store is currently being created to support evidence finder queries.

ENABLED means that an event data store was successfully created and evidence finder is enabled. We recommend that you wait 7 days until the event data store is backfilled with your past two years' worth of evidence data. You can use evidence finder in the meantime, but not all data might be available until the backfill is complete.
DISABLE_IN_PROGRESS means that you requested to disable evidence finder, and your request is pending the deletion of the event data store.
DISABLED means that you have permanently disabled evidence finder and the event data store has been deleted. You can't re-enable evidence finder after this point.

nested_items.name: backfillStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the evidence data backfill process.
NOT_STARTED means that the backfill hasn't started yet.
IN_PROGRESS means that the backfill is in progress. This can take up to 7 days to complete, depending on the amount of evidence data.
COMPLETED means that the backfill is complete. All of your past evidence is now queryable.

nested_items.name: error
nested_items.description: Represents any errors that occurred when enabling or disabling evidence finder.

nested_items.name: deregistrationPolicy
nested_items.description: The deregistration policy for your Audit Manager data. You can use this attribute to determine how your data is handled when you deregister Audit Manager.

nested_items.name: deleteResources
nested_items.description: Specifies which Audit Manager data will be deleted when you deregister Audit Manager.
If you set the value to ALL, all of your data is deleted within seven days of deregistration.

If you set the value to DEFAULT, none of your data is deleted at the time of deregistration. However, keep in mind that the Audit Manager data retention policy still applies. As a result, any evidence data will be deleted two years after its creation date. Your other Audit Manager resources will continue to exist indefinitely.

nested_items.name: defaultExportDestination
nested_items.description: The default S3 destination bucket for storing evidence finder exports.

nested_items.name: destinationType
nested_items.description: The destination type, such as Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: destination
nested_items.description: The destination bucket where Audit Manager stores exported files.
